result.execSummary:
The defendant Gavin M Gross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 40 days served.
Concurrent with: 14CF1120

superMiscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED. COSTS PAID IN FULL.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Not to use or possess any dangerous weapons.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with any co actors, or victim or her residence or Eric N.
Provide a DNA sample if not already provided.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.

pretrial incarceration credit sheet

Defendant Gavin M Gross in court with Attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  Attorney Detert makes statements regarding issues/corrections with presentence investigation.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Detert makes statements regarding sentencing.  James J. makes statements.  Holly B. makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

54  MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 40 days)   *CONCURRENT*
  -  24 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  30 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-actors or victim or her residence or Eric N.
____Not to use or possess any dangerous weapons
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done (no surcharges)

COSTS:  $278.00  (to be paid out of cash bail posted($2,500.00) and remainder to be returned to poster)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
CORRECTED ORDER  (to correct report due date on form)
Sentencing hearing at 04-07-2016 01:30 pm
